Articles.Content:
Salutations.

I have recently amassed a large quantity of Nerf guns. I have also made and bought several other fake weapons.

This here\'s a video of my arsenal of dull weapons:

http://youtu.be/SpnqbIXzvfM

In order:

Comb Balisong (Butterfly Knife/'Spy knife')

Combat knives with hand guards

Paper crossbow (non-functional)

Renaissance Mercenary War Hammer

Let me know what you think, and maybe, if you like it, I\'ll do a little showcase of my Nerf arsenal.

Godspeed.
Those paper weapons look deadly. I mean, you could give someone a paper cut and bleed them to death!

They\'re nice and all if you\'re attacked by a rock, but you\'ll be slaughtered if anyone brings scissors.

And they won\'t do any good against zombies. You should get something like...

He is 11, How will he get the gun licence to get the guns ( I think).
Yeah, I think he\'s 11. I mean, Judging by his you tube channel that is

He is 11, How will he get the gun licence to get the guns ( I think).

Don\'t care how old he is. I still stand by my statement.

Also I take advantage of any chance I get to post that picture.

He is 11, How will he get the gun licence to get the guns ( I think).

Three states in the USA requires a purchaser permit for long guns. Four for Handguns (that I am positive on) New Jersey Massachussetts and Illionios require a purchaser to get a permit, Nebraska requires only lhandguns.

Most states if your eighteen and do not have any legal issues, you can walk into a store that has a FFL holder and you can purchase whatever you want.

Also take a guess as to what these two rifles are (they are mine).

Luckily, I\'m not American! But yes, I am 11.
WOOT! America, the land where you can buy as many $@&% guns as you ^&#@ want! Let\'s go shoot a large animal! 8) Seriously, I love being an American.

...in stark contrast to my beloved (ex-) home country Germany, where Airsoft guns over .5J are legally treated as firearms.

where Airsoft guns over .5J are legally treated as firearms.
Airsoft guns (...) firearms.
firearms

Yeah, just a cheapy $30ish one. Doesn\'t take high velocity ammo well. Killed the last one that way. I want to get another for my CZ, one that will handle HV ammo, but haven\'t gotten around to it.
My Marlin chewed it up. What was the issue?

My Marlin chewed it up. What was the issue?

High velocity ammo knocks the baffle out of position, then the next bullet hits it.

It just a little rubber gasket and a spring.
Ah, issues with your can. I never had that issue. New Jersey says no to cans.
